description:

Build sales projections, prepare strategies and buy plans for the APAC region by working closely with HQ. Create annual open-to-buy/open-to-sell budgets and plans, and insure these plans are executed properly by working closely with merchandising teams (the buyers). The position is responsible for maximising financial objectives (sales and margins) and productivity (sell through, inventory). It also leads price index recommendation, stock transfers among APAC, and mark down strategies.

MAIN TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES

Sales Forecasts & OTB

Build sales projections for budgets & forecasts, and 3YPs from a business perspective for Retail and Merchandising, for discussion with country heads and Finance
Develop OTB budgets based upon sales history & projections, and assortment (width, depth, collection), define investment by SKUs, insure Countries’ budgets and buy plans are executed in accordance to HQ and APAC strategies
Prepare analysis with insights from historical sales performance, sales trends and target financial KPIs by working closely with HQs and country planners, to facilitate future buys
Supervise and support country planners to ensure merchandise appear in the right store at the right time and in the right quantities and assortment, involving planning stock levels and monitoring sales performance
Analyse and reforecast businesses to flag risks and identify growth opportunities
Set up OTB procedures for the region so that country heads and buyers are clear of objectives and actions for their buys
Partner with Merchandising and Retail to lay out action plans for risks and opportunities identified
Core & Continuative Planning

Plan sales and forecasts appropriate inventory levels by SKU for core
Build planning modules (e.g. stock plans, SKU plans, store ranking/attributes & key demographics) that will help the team to plan, manage and analyse business
Manage core receipts and inventory against targeted months of supply objectives
Propose action plan to sustain sales trend and guarantee ideal stock cover (reorders/transfers/buys)
Business Analysis

Consolidate weekly/monthly sales analysis for APAC and HQ
Regularly work with country planners and buyers to understand best sellers/slow movers, to anticipate consolidation strategies, allocation/reallocation, and replenishment
Recommend price index and gross margins (maximise ROI) for the region and for each country
Analyse end of season markdowns and propose markdown strategies based on inventory and sales analysis by countries, by locations to ensure cohesive flow from one season to the next
Analyse intended orders and determine whether the orders (on APAC basis) are coherent to the business objectives
Harmonise report standards among APAC
Inventory Management

Anticipate shipments, receipting capacity, display, BOH of each country to minimise congestions, maximise sales opportunities, sell through, and margins by working closely with logistics
Perform effective inventory control, inventory management best practices
Others

Be the key point of contact and the superuser for EPM project, including training and deployment
Ad hoc projects as assigned
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Min. undergraduate degree in merchandising, retail management, fashion management or similar discipline
10 to 15 years of relevant experience in merchandising planning from luxury retail industry, with APAC coverage
Some experience in buy/retail management/retail sales a definite plus
Excellent Excel ability
Excellent communication and negotiation skill sets, entrepreneurial mindset (business driven), and hands on
Fluent English and Mandarin
